scrabble

Class LetterRack

  • java.lang.Object
    • scrabble.LetterRack
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LetterContainer

    public class LetterRack
extends java.lang.Object
implements LetterContainer
    Class that represents a rack of letters. A Rack consists of a number of letters that are available for the player to use. Letters are extracted randomly from the Letter Bag.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    George Piskas

    • Constructor Detail

      • LetterRack

        public LetterRack(LetterBag bagOfLtrs)
        Letter Rack constructor. Rack size set to 7 (default scrabble rack). Creates a letter rack for a player that holds letters in an array list. Rack size is 7, as in the default scrabble version.
        Parameters:
        bagOfLtrs - the bag to extract letters from

      • LetterRack

        public LetterRack(LetterBag bagOfLtrs,
          int theRackSize)
        Letter Rack constructor with custom rack size. Creates a letter rack for a player that holds letters in an array list. Rack size is defined.
        Parameters:
        bagOfLtrs - the bag to extract letters from
        theRackSize - rack size for custom scrabble versions

      • playLetters

        public void playLetters(LetterBag bagOfLtrs,
               java.util.ArrayList<Letter> usedLetters)
        When a player chooses to play, letters are placed on the board and removed from the rack. The letters are removed from the rack and the rack is refilled if there are enough letters in the bag. If there are not enough, he gets all remaining letters.
        Parameters:
        bagOfLtrs - the bag to extract letters from
        usedLetters - the letters that were played

      • refreshLetters

        public void refreshLetters(LetterBag bagOfLtrs,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Letter> returnedLtrs)
        Refreshes the letters a player wants to switch with others. Returns a number of letter back to the bag and the player recieves an equal number of new randomly picked letters from the bag. The old letters are placed back in the bag and the new letters are extracted from the bag and placed on the player's rack.
        Parameters:
        bagOfLtrs - the bag to extract letters from
        returnedLtrs - the letters to return to the bag

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns rack's information.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Info returned is the size of the board and the info of each cell
